# ***State and Props***

## ***React lifecycle***
the lifecycle of the react is devided into 3 parts

![dvdvd](https://i2.wp.com/programmingwithmosh.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Screen-Shot-2018-10-31-at-1.44.28-PM.png?ssl=1)

### 1- Mounting
When an instance of a component is being created and inserted into the DOM it occurs during the mounting phase.

what order can be exited:
1. getDerivedStateFromProps
2. render
3. componentDidMount
4. UNSAFE_componentWillMount 


### 2-Updating
Anytime a component is updated or state changes then it is rerendered. These lifecycle events happen during updating in this order.

what order can be exited:
1. getDerivedStateFromProps
2. shouldComponentUpdate
3. render
4. getSnapshotBeforeUpdate
5. componentDidUpdate   
6. UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate

### 3-Unmounting
The final phase of the lifecycle if called when a component is being removed from the DOM.
the only thing that can be applyed here is  componentWillUnmount

## ***React Bootstrap***
we can use it to designe the front-end for web site
